headline: Post-OPEC Angola: The Quota’s Gone, the Decline Isn’t
summary: The government stopped publishing official output figures after November 2023, just weeks before its departure became effective in January 2024, but exports tell the story.

raw.headline: Post-OPEC Angola: The Quota’s Gone, the Decline Isn’t
raw.summary: The government stopped publishing official output figures after November 2023, just weeks before its departure became effective in January 2024, but exports tell the story.

headline: US oil giants produce mainly at home but send more tax dollars overseas
summary: US fossil fuel giants produce most of their oil and gas domestically but pay billions more in taxes overseas than they do at home because of subsidies that have only grown during President Donald Trump's second term, a report said Thursday.Another leading US giant, ConocoPhillips, paid more than twice as much tax to Libya as it did to the US, despite producing more than 70 percent of its oil and gas domestically.

raw.headline: US oil giants produce mainly at home but send more tax dollars overseas

headline: 3 Integrated Energy Stocks Standing Tall Despite Soft Oil Price
summary: Rising demand for renewable energy is adding uncertainty to the Zacks Oil and Gas Integrated International industry's outlook. XOM, CVX and BP will probably overcome market challenges.

raw.headline: 3 Integrated Energy Stocks Standing Tall Despite Soft Oil Price

headline: Shares in Oil Companies Advance
summary: Shares of global energy companies rose after the U.S. imposed substantial new sanctions on Russia's oil giants, boosting benchmark crude-oil and natural-gas prices.    In the U.S., shares of Exxon Mobil (XOM), Occidental Petroleum (OXY) and Chevron (CVX) rose in morning trading.

summary: SHEL's disciplined strategy, rising LNG strength and valuation edge make it look better positioned than its Big Oil rival.

headline: Chevron Stock Jumps 2.3% After Partnerships Are Shares Attractively Priced in 2025
summary: Trying to figure out what to do with Chevron stock? You're not alone. Many investors are taking another look after the company's recent moves, wondering if now is the right time to buy, hold, or wait it out. Over the last week, Chevron saw a healthy 2.3% bump, helping to offset some of the milder moves earlier this year. Year to date, the stock is up 6.0%. Looking at the past five years, the gains are an impressive 188.7%. These numbers suggest the company has held up well over time, even in...
